sentences.chinese: 田儋者，狄人也，故齊王田氏族也。
sentences.literal: Tian Dan was a man of Di. He was of the clan of the former kings of Qi, the Tian family.

sentences.chinese: 儋從弟田榮，榮弟田橫，皆豪，宗彊，能得人。
sentences.literal: Dan's cousin Tian Rong, and Rong's younger brother Tian Heng, were all heroic figures. Their clan was powerful and they could attract followers.

sentences.chinese: 陳涉之初起王楚也，使周市略定魏地，北至狄，狄城守。
sentences.literal: When Chen She first rose and declared himself king of Chu, he sent Zhou Shi to raid and pacify the lands of Wei, reaching north to Di, where Di defended its city.

sentences.chinese: 田儋詳為縛其奴，從少年之廷，欲謁殺奴。
sentences.literal: Tian Dan pretended to bind his slave and followed some youths to the county court, intending to meet with the magistrate and kill the slave.

sentences.chinese: 遂自立為齊王，發兵以擊周市。
sentences.literal: He then established himself as King of Qi and sent troops to attack Zhou Shi.

sentences.chinese: 周市軍還去，田儋因率兵東略定齊地。
sentences.literal: Zhou Shi's army retreated, and Tian Dan then led troops east to raid and pacify the lands of Qi.

sentences.chinese: 秦將章邯圍魏王咎於臨濟，急。
sentences.literal: The Qin general Zhang Han besieged King Jiu of Wei at Linji, and the situation was urgent.

sentences.chinese: 魏王請救於齊，齊王田儋將兵救魏。
sentences.literal: The King of Wei requested aid from Qi, and King Tian Dan of Qi led troops to save Wei.

sentences.chinese: 章邯夜銜枚擊，大破齊、魏軍，殺田儋於臨濟下。
sentences.literal: Zhang Han attacked at night with wooden gags in their mouths, greatly defeating the Qi and Wei armies, killing Tian Dan below Linji.

sentences.chinese: 儋弟田榮收儋餘兵東走東阿。
sentences.literal: Dan's younger brother Tian Rong gathered Dan's remaining troops and fled east to Dong'e.

sentences.chinese: 田榮之走東阿，章邯追圍之。
sentences.literal: When Tian Rong fled to Dong'e, Zhang Han pursued and besieged him.

sentences.chinese: 項梁聞田榮之急，乃引兵擊破章邯軍東阿下。
sentences.literal: Xiang Liang heard of Tian Rong's urgency and led troops to attack and break Zhang Han's army below Dong'e.

sentences.chinese: 章邯走而西，項梁因追之。
sentences.literal: Zhang Han fled west, and Xiang Liang then pursued him.

sentences.chinese: 而田榮怒齊之立假，乃引兵歸，擊逐齊王假。
sentences.literal: But Tian Rong was angry that Qi had established a puppet king, so he led troops back and attacked to drive away the puppet King of Qi.
The puppet king fled to Chu.
